meanings.definition: Write (something) in a hurried, careless way.
meanings.sent1: She would scrawl her name quickly on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The student would scrawl notes in a rush during the lecture.
meanings.sent3: In a hurry, he managed to scrawl a messy signature on the document.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti artist would scrawl his tag across the city walls.
meanings.sent5: The child scrawled a message in the sand, giggling mischievously.

meanings.definition: A piece of writing or drawing done in a hurried, careless way.
meanings.sent1: The note was just a scrawl, barely legible.
meanings.sent2: The wall was covered in scrawls and doodles.
meanings.sent3: The scrawl on the napkin made her chuckle at its messiness.
meanings.sent4: Among the scrawls, there was a hidden message waiting to be deciphered.
meanings.sent5: The scrawl on the whiteboard caught everyone's attention with its boldness.
